ShowConfirmationModal(String, Boolean, Boolean, i18nArg[])

Shows and returns a generic modal with some text, a Yes button, and a No button.

if yesClosesModal or noClosesModal is false, onClick callbacks must be manually added to the buttons via the out Confirmation object.

The reason any callbacks must be manually added instead of passed as method parameters is so that they can be created after the user has a reference to the returned Modal.

This is necessary for when a callback does not want to immediately close the modal when a button is clicked,

e.g. when showing a loading spinner in the yes button while a API call completes before closing the modal.

Declaration
public static ConfirmationModal ShowConfirmationModal(string bodyText, bool yesClosesModal, bool noClosesModal, params i18nArg[] args)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.String bodyText
System.Boolean yesClosesModal
System.Boolean noClosesModal
i18nArg[] args
Returns
Type Description
ConfirmationModal

ShowConfirmationModal(String, UnityAction, UnityAction, String, String, i18nArg[])

Shows and returns a generic modal with some text, a Yes button, and a No button. Clicking either button immediately closes the modal, as well as invoking any given callback.
